trope_detail: Pike protects Vina by standing in front of her ready to take on the large brute.
Pike: I'm not used to having a woman on the bridge. (says Pike who has a woman as second-in-command.)

Dr. Crater: Nothing. Its just that it gives me pleasure to know that she's gotten to see an old friend and has a chance for some company. Its different for me, I enjoy solitude. But for a woman. You understand, of course.
Salt Creature appears as a hooker from a pleasure planet to Darnell.
Charlie (to Yeoman Rand): You smell like a girl.
Charlie Evans slaps Yeoman Rand on the ass cause that's what he saw the crewmen do to each other. That's the way men are.
Charlie:  I have something for you. (a rose). Pink is your favorite, isn't it?
Lt. Cmdr. Gary Mitchell holds Yeoman Colts hand the whole the ship is in danger. Didn't anyone tell him to keep both hands on the console during emergencies?
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: Lt. Cmdr. Gary Mitchell: she's (Dr. Dehner) a walking freezer unit.
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: Kirk: I have a beautiful yeoman. Have you noticed her, Mister Spock? You're allowed to notice her. The Captain's not permitted.
Crewmen blocks Yeoman Rand. Spock order the crewman to stand aside and then leaves. Yeoman Rand calls for Spock when the crewman starts harassing her again.
Yeoman Rand prettying herself in front of mirror. A prime function of a starship yeoman.
Yeoman Rand acts like helpless victim after the attempted rape. Yeoman Rand: I can understand. I don't want to get you into trouble. I wouldn't have even mentioned it!
Kirk: A woman only needs to think she's beautiful to be beautiful.
Ben Childress (to Eve): I'm supposed to sit, taste it, roll my eyes and, whooo, female cooking again.
Ben Childress (to Kirk): You mean they all really look like she does? (meaning a woman is worthless unless she's good looking.)
Eve (to Kirk): It's all the same, no men.
Eve McHuron: The sound of the male ego. Travel halfway across the galaxy and its still the same song.
Harry Mudd sends the women to seduce crewman to get what they need to deal with the miners.
Miners want something that's not real about the women.
Kirk seduces the android Andrea. She can't resist him.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: After McCoy announces the good news he may have found the magic antidote, Kirk turns to hug Yeoman Rand.
Yeoman Rand (to Kirk): I used to try to get to get you to look at my legs. Now look at them.
Kirk: When I find the headquarters genius that assigned me a Yeoman. | McCoy What's the matter Jim, don't you trust yourself?.
Yeoman walks by to sexy trumpet music.
McCoy: Khan has a magnetism, almost electric and it could overpower Lt. McGivers with her preoccupation with the past.
Kirk: Men were more adventuresome and bolder, more colorful | Lt. McGivers: Yes sir, I think they were.
Lt. McGivers apologizes to Khan about Kirks behavior.
Lt. McGivers fawns over Khan at court martial.
Lt. McGivers promises to do anything Khan asks. Even betray Kirk and the Enterprise.
Lt. McGivers rearranged her hair as Khan suggested in order to please him.
Khan changes Lt. McGivers hairdo saying the hair should hand freely. Then he pets the back of her neck.
Khan gives Lt. McGivers ultimatium. Either leave or ask for permission to stay.
Khan. Generally a sex symbol to all the women on board.
Only women will show their fear of a situation. | Uhura: Captain, I'm frightened (realizing they're stranded).
ep_title: The City on the Edge of Forever

trope_detail: Kirk holds Aurelan Kirk as she screams from the parasites sting.
Nurse Chapel cries with happiness about getting Spock to Vulcan.
Apollo: Beauty... Grace... You seem wise for a woman   | Apollo compliments Lt. Carolyn Palamas’ physical attributes, and seems genuinely surprised by her intelligence.
Nomad: That unit is defective. Its thinking is chaotic. Absorbing it unsettled me. | Spock:  that unit is a woman | Nomad: A mass of conflicting impulses.
